Topic.Title: Surface is a bust already

Message.Msg: The 'modest' sales numbers for Surface Tablets are caused by the not-so-modest price tag. Ouch! One problem with the Surface Tablet is the Bloatware. Windows 8 RT takes 16gb of flash memory just to install it. You need at least 32gb of flash memory for a usable system. iOS can install on 16gb of flash memory with plenty of room to spare. This doubles the cost of the flash memory components of Surface Tablets. To make things even worse, many desktop users don't like Windows 8 and Metro. Why spend $500-600 for a device with a questionalble graphical interface? What about Apps? Existing Windows 7 and XP programs won't run on Windows 8 RT. Sorry, but I won't be buying a Surface Tablet.

Message.Title: Windows 8 Seen Slowing Laptop Sales
Message.Msg: Walk into any computer store and you'll see consumers looking at the new laptops, ultrabooks and tablets. Look at the people examining new laptops and you'll see confusion. They look like a deer staring into headlights because hardware instead of a familiar desk they see the display filled with tiles and they have no idea what to do. Instead of selling the laptop the salesperson tries to explain to the customer what has to be done to make Windows 8 tiles look and behave like the Windows 7 the customer understands, and even then its a futile effort. A principle of sales psychology holds that a confused mind says "No" and consumers are overwhelmingly confused and frustrated by what they see when shopping for a new laptop equipped with Windows 8, especially if the laptop doesn't have touch. However, the few laptops with touch on the store shelves start at a much higher price than the most customers want to buy. Laptops today can be purchased as a low as $399 but touch models start at about $800 but most start around $1100 or more. and these higher priced units are way beyond what most consumers want to spend in this economy. By the time the salesperson explains what has to be done to Windows 8 to make it even recognizable, plus the hours, days or even weeks spent configuring and having to relearn what they already knew how to do plus the possibility of having to install third party software to get a Start Menu that works, the customer says' "forget it" and walks away. Store salespeople have seen this scenario play out so many times they're reconfiguring the W8 PC's to look as much like W7 as possible, but it still isn't working. W8 is a disaster.

Topic.Title: w8 boots in less than 10 seconds

Message.Msg: try 2 seconds... I have raid 0 with 2 ssd intel 512gb drives with 32 gb ram. The whole OS is in memory...now if only motherboard manufacturers would put the OS on the motherboard with pci x 32 or 64 ...there would only be fractions of a second. Sorry to tell you but if you have under 16gb ram-your ram is now your bottleneck. If you have more than that your hdd is maxed out.

Topic.Title: Windows 8 Sucks

Message.Msg: That is only because you don't know how to set it up properly. Sorry but not a smart post. Yes it looks different but it doesn't have to. I get to the desktop automatically in 2 seconds and only one keyboard shortcut is needed to shut the machine down like a unix box. Corporations are scared of it but if your IT dept is skilled the user will only need to learn one thing - a keyboard shortcut to shut the machine down or log off. We just tape the commands on the monitor and keyboard and we have zero complaints about windows 8 in a 1000 user environment. Users did have .5hr PowerPoint video when logging into their new computers for the first time. We set them up so all the user had to do was log in and then the powerpoint presentation came up in runonce in the registry. Get some skill before posting please.

Message.Title: Windows 8 is very snappy... I like it a lot.
Message.Msg: Boot up is very fast(8 seconds after post from MOBO) When you start IE10, boom... it's almost instantaneous(default MS homepage) Wake up from sleep is also immediate("suspend to RAM" mode) Shut down in seconds. New build, budget machine with an APU. It does have a $60 SSD drive, but still nothing too fancy. I have never seen a machine this responsive. Even my Macbook seems a bit sluggish now. If you can get past the "tiles" crap, add a shutdown button to the new start screen, this is a significant improvement over Win7. Probably XP also, but who knows where old hardware becomes an issue. There are ways around the new start screen, but I am going to try to like it... for a while. I have b*tched that Microsoft needs to focus on performance and security. Time will tell on the security issue, but this is fast and worth the $40 upgrade price, or a good excuse to buy/build a new machine. Actually stoked about doing more with it.

Message.Title: Denny's and Dairy Queen to cut employee hours to 28
Message.Msg: Florida Denny’s And Dairy Queens Adding “Obamacare Surcharge” By Alan with 0comments November 15, 2012 12:11 John Metz, who runs 40 Denny’s and Dairy Queens, is putting a 5% surcharge on customers’ bills because of fears his business will be hit hard by Obamacare in 2014. And he plans to cut the hours of his employees. “I think it’s a terrible thing. It’s ridiculous that the maximum hours we can give people is 28 hours a week instead of 40,’’ the West Palm Beach businessman said. “It’s going to force my employees to go out and get a second job.’’ Metz plans to hold meetings at his restaurants next month to tell his staffers of the upcoming changes

Benghazi is an attempt by the Republicans to diminish the strong political capital Obama will have in negotiating tax rates. The Republicans are still fighting a war to keep tax rates on the wealthy low. This is being orchestrated by Grover Norquist.

Message.Title: MSFT is greedy just like APPL
Message.Msg: GOOG is smart. Microsoft wants to charge Mobile Apps developers $99 per year. An annual Dev Center subscription is $99 USD plus any applicable tax. Hey Microsoft, charge one time fees of $35 and I will start making mobile applications for Microsoft.

Message.Title: this isn't fiscal cliff related selling for MSFT
Message.Msg: You need profits and long term gains on the stock to do that - none of which applies to long term holders of MSFT because it has been a loser of a stock for so long... so this is selling is simply that windows 8 is a dud and expectations are now much lower. Tax loss selling maybe...

Topic.Title: Tablet Soup

Message.Msg: AAPL is down today. But why ? Windows 8 Phone on ARM phones ? Windows RT on ARM tablets ? Full Windows 8 on dual-core Intel Atom tablets ? Android on dual-core Intel Atom tablets ? Android on single-core Intel Atom phones ? Android on ARM tablets and phones ? That's three possibilities for each of Windows, Intel, and Android. And one possibility for Wintel. Or is it simply competition from all the computer makers and the killer app is not yet known ?

Message.Title: With apple going down with Fire from China MS safe bet for stability
Message.Msg: With apple going down with Fire from China MS safe bet for stability-buy some silver along with it and your portfolio will have a good base.

I guess if you investigation till dooms day you will never have to tell the American people the truth "The most transparent administration ever" LMFAO

Topic.Title: Is Apple the New Microsoft?

Message.Msg: "And if I would have to explain why... you wouldn't be smart enough to comprehend it." This is what is known in some quarters as an argument from intimidation. The clear intention is to intimidate anyone who might make so bold as to point out that you're making a completely unsupported assertion devoid of any content, and therefore you are full of it.

Topic.Title: Love the Win 8 -- this is revolution guys.

Message.Msg: Microsoft made the same criticism of those that complained about Vista and were those PC users wrong? Absolutely not. They tested it and they understand it's a waste of time. Just look at the number of articles and posts of people that say it's awful on anything without touch, and even awkward with large 24" and 27" touch monitors. One reporter said Microsoft "threw desktop users under the bus". PC customers will ultimately render a verdict and so far it's not good.

Topic.Title: Love the Win 8 -- this is revolution guys.

Message.Msg: We use Win7 pro now. what version of Win 8 would we use, with a mouse, no touchy - feally. And since I hate icons ( and tiles ) and don't care about Start buttons, why would we switch ?

Topic.Title: Why is it lefties never want to talk budget cuts until AFTER they have new taxes?

Message.Msg: i presume you do not refer to Obama as "leftiy" since he offered proposal to reduce the budget deficit through a package of spending cuts and tax increases but the extreme right-dominated reublicans refused to compromise, hence we are staring down the barrel of "fiscal cliff' fears driving the market sell-off in the face of the parties using their stale, irritating rhetoric to jockey for negotiating position to enable each side to proclaim victory in the face of compromise, which better come or else the US will become a laughing stock for its paralyzed dysfunctional useless impotent greedy politicians and the stock market will continue to crash
